intro: Microrrhinum praetermissum, commonly known as the lesser caraway, is a small annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant produces tiny, oval-shaped seeds that are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and sustainable agriculture.
